title: Power - velocity function with respect to time

content.question: Four identical objects, <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math>, <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>, <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>C</mtext></math>, and <math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>D</mtext></math>, experience different net forces. The net work done on each object as a function of time are shown below. To which of the four objects is the greatest instantaneous power delivered at <math alttext="8.0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>8</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>0</mn></math> seconds?

choices.label: The figure shows a graph of a line segment in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time, in seconds,” and the numbers 0.0 through 12.0, in increments of 2.0, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “Work, in joules,” and the numbers 0.0 through 10.0, in increments of 2.0, are indicated. The line segment begins at the point with coordinates 0.0 comma 0.0, and slants upward and to the right. It passes through the points with coordinates 2.0 comma 2.0 and 6.0 comma 6.0, and it ends at the point with coordinates 10.0 comma 10.0.

The figure shows a graph of a line segment in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time, in seconds,” and the numbers 0.0 through 12.0, in increments of 2.0, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “Work, in joules,” and the numbers 0.0 through 10.0, in increments of 2.0, are indicated. The line segment begins at the point with coordinates 0.0 comma 0.0, and slants upward and to the right and passes through the point with coordinates 10.0 comma 2.0, and ends at the point 12.0 comma 2.2.

The figure shows a graph of a concave down curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time, in seconds,” and the numbers 0.0 through 12.0, in increments of 2.0, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “Work, in joules,” and the numbers 0.0 through 10.0, in increments of 2.0, are indicated. The curve begins at the point with coordinates 0.0 comma 0.0, and moves steeply upward and to the right initially before levelling off. It passes through the points with coordinates 2.0 comma 4.5, and 6.0 comma 8.0, and it ends at the point with coordinates 12.0 comma 10.0.

The figure shows a graph of a concave up curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time, in seconds,” and the numbers 0.0 through 12.0, in increments of 2.0, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “Work, in joules,” and the numbers 0.0 through 10.0, in increments of 2.0, are indicated. The curve begins at the point with coordinates 0.0 comma 10.0, and moves steeply downward and to the right initially before levelling off. It passes through the points with coordinates 2.0 comma 5.5, and 6.0 comma 2.0, and it ends at the point with coordinates 12.0 comma 0.

content.answer: The figure shows a graph of a line segment in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time, in seconds,” and the numbers 0.0 through 12.0, in increments of 2.0, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “Work, in joules,” and the numbers 0.0 through 10.0, in increments of 2.0, are indicated. The line segment begins at the point with coordinates 0.0 comma 0.0, and slants upward and to the right. It passes through the points with coordinates 2.0 comma 2.0 and 6.0 comma 6.0, and it ends at the point with coordinates 10.0 comma 10.0.

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
